entry.title: Kaipokok Bay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the only populated place on Kaipokok Bay in Labrador, Canada, is Postville (pictured)?

entry.title: 69th Regiment Armory (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that unlike other armories in New York City, the 69th Regiment Armory was designed in the Beaux-Arts style because its architect did not want it to look like a "mediaeval castle"?

entry.title: Tsvetana Jermanova (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tsvetana Jermanova survived imprisonment in two forced labour camps in communist Bulgaria?

entry.title: Roots to Riches (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 2009 documentary concert special Roots to Riches, Regine Velasquez reunited and performed with her former talent show rival Eva Castillo?

entry.title: Hannah Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Hannah Davis authored highly cited articles on long COVID while battling the disease herself?

entry.title: Kansas Avenue Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that police were stationed on the new Kansas Avenue Bridge to prevent streetcar rails from being laid down?

entry.title: Jerónimo Saavedra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jerónimo Saavedra was the first openly gay politician to serve in several high public offices in Spain?

entry.title: Lemon & Te Aroha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand's Lemon & Te Aroha was created 19 years before the similarly named and more famous Lemon & Paeroa?
